content: In 1898 which 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' author spent time in Nevada prospecting for silver?

In 1898, the author of "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn," Mark Twain, spent time in Nevada prospecting for silver. Twain, whose real name was Samuel Langhorne Clemens, had a long-standing interest in mining and prospecting, and he made several attempts to strike it rich through mining investments throughout his life. His experiences in Nevada during this period likely influenced some of his writings and added to his colorful biography as a humorist and novelist.
